title: An Ocean View
opening: Western Church extremists have taken over land sacred to Cichol, one of the Four Saints. Seteth heads out the rid the area of them, and Flayn insists on going along.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: Brother, please wait!

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: For the last time, Flayn, the answer is no.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: You are departing for the Rhodos Coast, are you not? I must come!

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: You will do no such thing. I am not going there to pay respects at the cemetery, but to do battle. With you there, I will be beside myself with worry. It will be easier for me to fight if I know you are safe.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: But...I must!

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: Professor! You have come at just the right time.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: What's going on?

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: Surely it must be fate that you have appeared at a time of my greatest need!

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I don't like the sound of that...

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: I only wish to make a small request.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: My dear brother is about to set forth on a most dangerous mission.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: A mission?

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: Indeed. The Western Church is attempting to seize sacred ground by force. Though they now have a new bishop, it seems that a radical faction has emerged to resist the new order. We cannot allow the holy artifacts enshrined there to fall into their hands.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: I, too, wish to be of use to the church! And I do admit I am terribly worried about my brother. No matter my protests, he will not allow me to come. Professor, this is where you can help. Will you accompany us both on this expedition?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Why me?

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: If you are there to protect me, my brother's fears will be allayed. Isn't that right, Brother?

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: I suppose your aid would indeed be useful, yes.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: I knew it! Please, Professor, will you join us?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Very well.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: Wonderful. Let us depart at once!

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Not right now.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: Please tend to your errands promptly. Then you will come along with us, yes?

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: There is still time before we must depart. If you are able to accompany us, let me know.

battle.speaker: Priest
battle.line: You heretics, who defile our goddess! The sacred coast belongs to us, the Western Church!

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: You are the heretics! Begone from here at once!

battle.speaker: Priest
battle.line: Silence, dog of the apostate! Prepare to receive our righteous blades!

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: I will recapture the monument. Everyone else should focus on removing the surrounding enemies.

battle.speaker: Flayn
battle.line: Wait, Brother! I shall accompany you!

battle.speaker: Flayn
battle.line: Leave! Let Mother rest in peace!

battle.speaker: Priest
battle.line: It is our duty to worship Saint Cichol! We will not allow heretics to come near!

battle.speaker: Priest
battle.line: It's like the goddess herself commanded me to live... I must offer her my thanks.

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: The goddess doesn't want your thanks!

battle.speaker: Priest
battle.line: But it was...for the sake of the goddess...

battle.speaker: Priest
battle.line: The goddess protects us! We will never yield to the likes of you!

battle.speaker: Priest
battle.line: I got away, thanks to the protection of the goddess!

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: Insufferable arrogance! We'll have to send someone after them...

battle.speaker: Priest
battle.line: Heretics! Prepare to taste the power of the true servants of the goddess!

battle.speaker: Priest
battle.line: We're no match for them... Brothers... Retreat...

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: Do you dare compound your crimes further? There will be no escape for you!

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: That is the last of them. Flayn...will you place some flowers at the monument?

battle.speaker: Flayn
battle.line: Of course, Brother. That is what I came here to do.

character-falls.speaker: Flayn
character-falls.line: This place... is very precious to me... please... protected it... for me...

character-falls.speaker: Seteth
character-falls.line: I must pull back... I leave the rest to you. Do not let them take this position.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: Your assistance is most appreciated. I can only hope that the Western Church will now see reason and abandon this place. But just to be safe, I have retrieved the holy artifacts. We cannot risk them falling into their hands. I will entrust them to you. I must confess, despite the situation, it was a pleasure to return here. This coast has a certain sentimental significance to my sister and me.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Sentimental significance?

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: Yes. This stone monument is not merely here to commemorate Saint Cichol. It is also the grave of my wife.

end.speaker: Flayn
end.line: You are safe now, Mother. Finally, you may find peace.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Your mother is also buried here?

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: I suppose you have earned the right to know. But this must remain between us. Flayn is actually my daughter. My late wife and her mother are the same person.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I had no idea.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: Due to certain...circumstances, it is more convenient for us to masquerade as siblings for the time being.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I suspected as much.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: And here I thought we had hidden it skillfully.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: There are many who would seek to harm Flayn due to the unique blood she bears. Falsifying her identity is necessary to conceal her from such individuals. Mercifully, I happen to look quite young for my age. We make rather convincing siblings, do we not?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: That's true enough.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: If you say so.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: Hm. I was certain our cover was adequate.

end.speaker: Flayn
end.line: Mother loved the coast so much. She and I came here together often. Fishing was her favorite pastime. I used to sit and watch while she cast her line.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: I remember it fondly. You did so love to eat the fish she caught, as well.

end.speaker: Flayn
end.line: Fish is my favorite food, it is true. Due in no small part to Mother.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: I still come here to fish, from time to time, using the skills my wife taught me. It reminds me how deeply I appreciate those years... and how I wish I could return to them.

end.speaker: Flayn
end.line: We cannot turn back the clock, Father. We must live our lives fully, in the present moment.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: You're right. That is what she always said, isn't it? Dwell too much on the past, and you may be unable to move forward. Come, then. Let us return home.

end.speaker: Flayn
end.line: Good-bye, Mother. I love you. I shall bring flowers again for you next time.
